instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 no start
threads.message:
New to this boards. Some waterdamage in trackpad connector area and burned connector. Replaced shorted connector and worked. After connecting keyboard board died again, guess keyboard waterdamaged too.

Board now have 20V and draws 0.15A

ppbus_g3h 13.1
3V3_G3H 3.4
pp3v3_s4 3.3
pp5v_s4 5.12
pp3v3_s0 0v
PP5V_S0    5.12v                                                     
   
SMC_PM_G2_EN 1.8v
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 3.2v
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK  0.24v
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD 1v

threads.title: 820-00840 no start
threads.message:
"pp3v3_s0 v"
Check diode mode there.
Also check U8220 input and enable.

Test the board alone, nothing connected, apart of charger.

threads.title: 820-00840 no start
threads.message: sorry seems to been something wrong with first measurement. Now pp3v3_s0 there 3.3v. Have the bord on desk with only charger connected on all measurements

threads.title: 820-00840 no start
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE (L7210/20)?
If yes, check USB activity.

threads.title: 820-00840 no start
threads.message: checked with thermal cam and U7210 heated up, replaced it and now back to working and booting. But how do keyboard short out U7210?
